result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn N Helm-Clark

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shawn N Helm-Clark in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Shawn N Helm-Clark.  Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Plea Hearing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. 
Court is in receipt Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum.  
Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
 
PLEA HEARING PROCEEDED: 

AS TO COUNT 2:  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.   
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea. 
 Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  
Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his her civil rights are restored. 
Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample nd advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 
Case is adjourned for sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant Community Service Letter, received and filed.

Defendant Shawn N Helm-Clark in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requesting a plea and sentencing date.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Shawn N Helm-Clark in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested an additional scheduling date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shawn N Helm-Clark in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Pritzlaff. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Shawn N Helm-Clark in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Shawn N Helm-Clark in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shawn N Helm-Clark appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Shawn N Helm-Clark
Current: 5247 N 88TH CT, Milwaukee, WI 53225   (Effective: 03-09-2022)
Prior: 3888 North 44th Street #upper, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
